                                          <gco:CharacterString>NGDC Hurricane Sandy Digital                                                   Elevation Models</gco:CharacterString>                                             </gmd:name>                                             <gmd:description>                                                 <gco:CharacterString>Project webpage with general                                                   information and access to DEM tiles, metadata                                                   records and project                                                   specifications</gco:CharacterString>                                             </gmd:description>                                             <gmd:function>                                                 <gmd:CI_OnLineFunctionCode codeList="http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/xsd/schema/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode"                       </gmd:onlineResource>                                 </gmd:CI_Contact>                             </gmd:contactInfo>                             <gmd:role gco:nilReason="inapplicable"/>                         </gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>                     </gmd:citedResponsibleParty>                     <gmd:presentationForm>                         <gmd:CI_PresentationFormCode codeList="http://www.isotc211.org/2005/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_PresentationFormCode" codeListValue="mapDigital">mapDigital</gmd:CI_PresentationFormCode>                     </gmd:presentationForm>                 </gmd:CI_Citation>             </gmd:citation>             <gmd:abstract>                 <gco:CharacterString>NOAA's National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC) is developing a                     suite of digital elevation models (DEMs) of the U.S. Atlantic Coast impacted by                     Hurricane Sandy in October 2012. The DEMs telescope from the deep ocean floor to                     the coastal zone in 3, 1, 1/3, and 1/9 arc-second cell sizes. Only the 1/9                     arc-second DEMs integrate both bathymetric and topographic data; the remaining                     DEMs map bathymetry only. DEMs are tiled to enable targeted, rapid updates as                     new data become available. Source topographic and bathymetric data utilized for                     DEM creation were contributed by a variety of sources, including the NOAA Office                     of Coast Survey, NOAA National Geodetic Survey, NOAA Coastal Services Center,                     U.S. Geological Survey, and the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers. The DEMs are                     referenced vertically to the North American Vertical Datum of 1988. The vertical                     units of the data are meters. The DEMs are referenced horizontally to the North                     American Datum of 1983. The horizontal units of the data are decimal                     degrees.</gco:CharacterString>             </gmd:abstract>             <gmd:purpose>                 <gco:CharacterString>These data were developed under the Disaster Relief                     Appropriations Act of 2013 (aka "Sandy Supplemental") to support improved                     hurricane forecasting and warning efforts.</gco:CharacterString>             </gmd:purpose>             <gmd:status>                 <gmd:MD_ProgressCode codeList="http://www.isotc211.org/2005/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode" codeListValue="inProgress">inProgress</gmd:MD_ProgressCode>             </gmd:status> <gmd:description>                                 <gco:CharacterString>Project webpage with general information and                                     access to DEM tiles, metadata records and project                                     specifications</gco:CharacterString>                             </gmd:description>                             <gmd:function>                                 <gmd:CI_OnLineFunctionCode codeList="http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/xsd/schema/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode"    <gmd:scope>                 <gmd:DQ_Scope>                     <gmd:level>                         <gmd:MD_ScopeCode codeList="http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/xsd/schema/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode" codeListValue="dataset">dataset</gmd:MD_ScopeCode>                     </gmd:level>                 </gmd:DQ_Scope>             </gmd:scope>             <gmd:report>                 <gmd:DQ_AbsoluteExternalPositionalAccuracy>                     <gmd:nameOfMeasure>                         <gco:CharacterString>Horizontal Positional Accuracy                             Report</gco:CharacterString>                     </gmd:nameOfMeasure>                     <gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                         <gco:CharacterString>The horizontal accuracy of the DEM is dependent upon                             the accuracy of source data used to determine corresponding cell values,                             horizontal resolution of the DEM and the interpolation algoritm used.                             The horizontal accuracy for DEM tiles was not quantitatively                             evaluated.</gco:CharacterString>                     </gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                     <gmd:result gco:nilReason="missing"/>                 </gmd:DQ_AbsoluteExternalPositionalAccuracy>             </gmd:report>             <gmd:report>                 <gmd:DQ_AbsoluteExternalPositionalAccuracy>                     <gmd:nameOfMeasure>                         <gco:CharacterString>Vertical Positional Accuracy                             Report</gco:CharacterString>                     </gmd:nameOfMeasure>                     <gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                         <gco:CharacterString>The vertical accuracy of the DEM is dependent upon the                             accuracy of source data used to determine corresponding cell values,                             horizontal resolution of the DEM and the interpolation algoritm used.                             The vertical accuracy for DEM tiles was not quantitatively                             evaluated.</gco:CharacterString>                     </gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                     <gmd:result gco:nilReason="missing"/>                 </gmd:DQ_AbsoluteExternalPositionalAccuracy>             </gmd:report>             <gmd:report>                 <gmd:DQ_CompletenessCommission>                     <gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                         <gco:CharacterString>NGDC made every effort to obtain all available digital                             bathymetric datasets in the region for use in building the                             DEM.</gco:CharacterString>                     </gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                     <gmd:result gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                 </gmd:DQ_CompletenessCommission>             </gmd:report>             <gmd:report>                 <gmd:DQ_ConceptualConsistency>                     <gmd:measureDescription>                         <gco:CharacterString>Datasets were visually compared internally and                             externally (i.e. with other overlapping datasets and nautical charts) in                             to identify potentially anomalous elevations or data inconsistencies.                             The most recent (typically the highest spatial resolution) data                             supersede older, less dense data.</gco:CharacterString>                     </gmd:measureDescription>                     <gmd:result gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                 </gmd:DQ_ConceptualConsistency>             </gmd:report>             <gmd:lineage>                 <gmd:LI_Lineage>                     <gmd:processStep>                         <gmi:LE_ProcessStep>                             <gmd:description>                                 <gco:CharacterString>All datasets obtained by NGDC were converted to                                     common horizontal and vertical datums of NAD83 geographic and                                     NAVD88, respectively, using NOAA's VDatum software. When                                     necessary, the data were also converted to a common file format,                                     ASCII xyz, using a variety of software, including                                     GDAL/OGR.</gco:CharacterString>                             </gmd:description>                             <gmd:dateTime>                                 <gco:DateTime>2014-07-01T00:00:00</gco:DateTime>                             </gmd:dateTime>                             <gmd:processor>                                 <gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>                                     <gmd:individualName>                                         <gco:CharacterString>Mike Sutherland</gco:CharacterString>                                     </gmd:individualName>                                     <gmd:organisationName>                                         <gco:CharacterString>DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NGDC > National                                             Geophysical Data Center, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department                                             of Commerce</gco:CharacterString>                                     </gmd:organisationName>                                     <gmd:contactInfo>                                         <gmd:CI_Contact>                                             <gmd:address>                                                 <gmd:CI_Address>                                                   <gmd:deliveryPoint>                                                   <gco:CharacterString>NOAA/NESDIS/NGDC 325 Broadway                                                   E/GC3</gco:CharacterString>                                                   </gmd:deliveryPoint>                                                   <gmd:city>                                                   <gco:CharacterString>Boulder</gco:CharacterString>                                                   </gmd:city>                                                   <gmd:administrativeArea>                                                   <gco:CharacterString>CO</gco:CharacterString>                                                   </gmd:administrativeArea>                                                   <gmd:postalCode>                                                   <gco:CharacterString>80305-3328</gco:CharacterString>                                                   </gmd:postalCode>                                                   <gmd:country>                                                   <gco:CharacterString>USA</gco:CharacterString>                                                   </gmd:country>                                                   <gmd:electronicMailAddress>                                                   <gco:CharacterString>mike.sutherland@noaa.gov</gco:CharacterString>                                                   </gmd:electronicMailAddress>                                                 </gmd:CI_Address>                                             </gmd:address>                                         </gmd:CI_Contact>                                     </gmd:contactInfo>                                     <gmd:role>                                         <gmd:CI_RoleCode codeList="http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/xsd/schema/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode" codeListValue="distributor">distributor</gmd:CI_RoleCode>                                     </gmd:role>                                 </gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>                             </gmd:processor>                         </gmi:LE_ProcessStep>                     </gmd:processStep>                     <gmd:processStep>                         <gmi:LE_ProcessStep>                             <gmd:description>                                 <gco:CharacterString>Datasets were visually inspected to identify                                     and edit data anomalies. Adjacent and overlapping datasets (i.e.                                     surveys) were compared with one another to ensure data                                     consistency.</gco:CharacterString>                             </gmd:description>                             <gmd:dateTime>                                 <gco:DateTime>2014-07-01T00:00:00</gco:DateTime>                             </gmd:dateTime>                         </gmi:LE_ProcessStep>                     </gmd:processStep>                     <gmd:processStep>                         <gmi:LE_ProcessStep>                             <gmd:description>                                 <gco:CharacterString>ASCII xyz files were gridded using GMT's                                     'surface' tool. The 'surface' tool uses a tensioned spline                                     algorithm to perform interpolation between data points to ensure                                     every cell of the output grid is contstrained by a value. The                                     resultant output NetCDF grid was converted to a GeoTIFF using                                     GDAL. These processes were performed on a tile-by-tile basis.                                     The tiles were evaluated for gridding artifacts and the                                     influence of anamolous source data. When necessary, source data                                     were edited and the problematic tile were re-gridded. The tiles                                     were also compared in regions of overlap to ensure minimal                                     elevation differences between coincident                                     pixels.</gco:CharacterString>                             </gmd:description>                             <gmd:dateTime>                                 <gco:DateTime>2014-07-01T00:00:00</gco:DateTime>                             </gmd:dateTime>                         </gmi:LE_ProcessStep>                     </gmd:processStep>                     <gmd:source>                         <gmd:LI_Source>                             <gmd:description>                                 <gco:CharacterString>Online database of NOAA NOS Hydrographic Survey                                     sounding data</gco:CharacterString>                             </gmd:description>                             <gmd:sourceCitation>                                 <gmd:CI_Citation>                                     <gmd:title>                                         <gco:CharacterString>NOS Hydrographic Surveys                 </gmd:name>                                                   <gmd:description>                                                   <gco:CharacterString>The National Geophysical Data                                                   Center (NGDC) maintains the National Ocean Service                                                   Hydrographic Data Base (NOSHDB) and Hydrographic                                                   Survey Meta Data Base (HSMDB). Both databases are                                                   populated by Office of Coast Survey with                                                   information acquired from its surveys and National                                                   Geodetic Service remote sensing. The databases                                                   provide extensive survey coverage of the coastal                                                   waters and exclusive economic zone of the United                                                   States and its territories.</gco:CharacterString>                                                   </gmd:description>
